author: Warhammer
description:
In the far future, it’s still handy to stay hidden where possible – and camo is one way to sneak your way to victory. Dan has three different approaches to paint camo in this video, so you can keep your troops out of their enemy’s eyeline.

Here’s a list of the paints we used in today’s video:

Base:
Abaddon Black
Celestra Grey
Death Guard Green
Maphiston Red
Mechanicus Standard Grey
Mournfang Brown

Layer:
Administratum Grey
Deepkin Flesh
Stormvermin Fur

Shade:
Athonian Camoshade
Nuln Oil
Targor Rageshade

Tools:
Small Layer Brush STC
Medium Shade Brush STC

If you enjoyed this and want to learn more, our YouTube channel has an array of beginner-friendly videos to get you started.

Follow for more Warhammer, more often:

title: Painting Three Styles of Camo | Warhammer 40,000
